bnf_parser

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • bnf_parser.Rule

  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  Rule.CallableContainer
      Inner class which acts as a container for every Callable.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Rule.CallableContainer> callables
      The list of Callable's which are equivalent to subrules.
      protected java.lang.Class<?> collectorClass
      The class of the Collector used by the rule.
      protected int collectorOverrideIndex
      When the rule used the collector of one of its Callable's its index is stored in this property.
      static int INFINITY
      Constant (almost) equal to infinity.
      protected int iteratorIndex
      The value of the iterator index when iterating through the Callable's.
      protected boolean mustMatchEndOfFile
      Equals true when the rule must match the end of the file.
      static int NO_COLLECTOR_OVERRIDE
      Constant used when a subrule collector does not override the rule collector.

      Returns the index of the last subrule (Callable) defined in the Rule.

      Please refer to matchString(String, int, int) and matchStringWithoutCollecting(String, int, int).

    • Method Detail

      • setCollector

        public Rule setCollector(java.lang.Class<?> collectorClass)
                  throws IncorrectCollectorException
        Sets the Collector used by the rule.
        Parameters:
        collectorClass - The class of the Collector to be used.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.
        Throws:
        IncorrectCollectorException - Thrown when the specified class does not extend Collector.

      • matchString

        public Rule matchString(java.lang.String string,
                        int minOccurences,
                        int maxOccurences)
        Defines a new subrule that must match the specified string a number of times comprised between minOccurencex and minOccurencex. This subrule will have a StringCollector.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be matched.
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • matchStringWithoutCollecting

        public Rule matchStringWithoutCollecting(java.lang.String string,
                                         int minOccurences,
                                         int maxOccurences)
        Defines a new subrule that must match the specified string a number of times comprised between minOccurencex and minOccurencex. This subrule won't have a StringCollector.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be matched.
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • matchPattern

        public Rule matchPattern(java.lang.String pattern,
                         int minOccurences,
                         int maxOccurences)
        Defines a new subrule that must match the specified pattern a number of times comprised between minOccurencex and minOccurencex. The pattern is a regular expression. This subrule will have a StringCollector.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to be matched.
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • matchPatternWithoutCollecting

        public Rule matchPatternWithoutCollecting(java.lang.String pattern,
                                          int minOccurences,
                                          int maxOccurences)
        Defines a new subrule that must match the specified pattern a number of times comprised between minOccurencex and minOccurencex. The pattern is a regular expression. This subrule won't have a StringCollector.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to be matched.
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • matchRule

        public Rule matchRule(Rule rule,
                      int minOccurences,
                      int maxOccurences)
        Defines a new subrule that must match the specified rule a number of times comprised between minOccurencex and minOccurencex. This subrule will use the Collector used by the specified rule.
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to be matched.
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • matchAnyRule

        public Rule matchAnyRule(int minOccurences,
                         int maxOccurences,
                         Rule... rules)
        Matches any rule contained in rules a number of times comprised between minOccurencex and minOccurencex. Since many rules may be specified, this subrule does not automatically use a Collector. The user by explicitly specify one using setCollector(Class).
        Parameters:
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        rules - An array of Rule's in which at least one must match.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • overrideCollector

        public Rule overrideCollector()
                       throws NoSubruleDefinedException
        Makes the rule use the Collector of the latest specified subrule.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.
        Throws:
        NoSubruleDefinedException - Thrown if no subrule was defined when this method was used.

      • setIndex

        public Rule setIndex(int index)
              throws NoSubruleDefinedException
        Associates an index with the latest subrule's Collector. This is useful to distinguish different Collector's of the same type.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to be associated with the latest subrule's Collector.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.
        Throws:
        NoSubruleDefinedException - Thrown if no subrule was defined when this method was used.

      • mustMatchEndOfFile

        public Rule mustMatchEndOfFile(boolean val)
        Sets wether or not the rule must match the end of the file being parsed.
        Parameters:
        val - Wether the rule must match the end of file (true) or not (false).
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • mustMatchEndOfFile

        public Rule mustMatchEndOfFile()
        Forces the rule to match the end of the file being parsed.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • createCollector

        Collector createCollector()
        Creates a new instance of the Collector associated with the rule.
        Returns:
        The instance of the newly created Collector.

      • resetIterator

        void resetIterator()
        Resets the iterator to the beginning of the list of Callable's. Since a Rule can be used many times, the parser must reset the iterator to be able to iterate again.

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()
        Returns wether or not the iterator has reached the end of the list of Callable's.
        Returns:
        true if the iterator still hasn't reached the end of the list, false if it is at the end.

      • next

        Callable next()
       throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Returns the next Callable in the list.
        Returns:
        The next Callable in the list.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - Just like built-in Java iterators, this exception is thrown if this method is called on an empty list or when the iterator has reached the end of the list.

      • noCollectorOverriding

        boolean noCollectorOverriding()
        Returns wether or not the Rule uses the Collector of one of its subrules.
        Returns:
        true if the Rule does not use the Collector of one of its subrules, false if is does.

      • doOverrideCollector

        boolean doOverrideCollector()
        Returns wether or not the Collector of the currentCallable returned by the iterator is the Collector used by the rule.
        Returns:

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Returns the index associated with the subrule's Collector to identify that collector. If no index was specified be the used, the value '-1' will be returned.
        Returns:
        The index associated with the subrule's Collector.

      • doMatchEndOfFile

        boolean doMatchEndOfFile()
        Returns wether or not the Rule must match the end of file.
        Returns:
        true if the Rule must match the end of file, false otherwise.

      • matchString

        protected Rule matchString(java.lang.String string,
                           int minOccurences,
                           int maxOccurences,
                           boolean collectString)
        Please refer to matchString(String, int, int) and matchStringWithoutCollecting(String, int, int). This method simply simplifies code and the two referenced methods simply use a different value for the parameter collectString.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be matched.
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        collectString - Wether or not the matched string must be collected in a StringCollector.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • matchPattern

        protected Rule matchPattern(java.lang.String pattern,
                            int minOccurences,
                            int maxOccurences,
                            boolean collectString)
        Please refer to matchPattern(String, int, int) and matchPatternWithoutCollecting(String, int, int). This method simply simplifies code and the two referenced methods simply use a different value for the parameter collectString.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to be matched.
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences.
        collectString - Wether or not the matched string must be collected in a StringCollector.
        Returns:
        'this' to allow chaining.

      • getPreviousCallableIndex

        protected int getPreviousCallableIndex()
                                throws NoSubruleDefinedException
        Returns the index of the last subrule (Callable) defined in the Rule. It is used by overrideCollector() and setIndex(int).
        Returns:
        The index of the last subrule (Callable) defied.
        Throws:
        NoSubruleDefinedException - Thrown if no subrule was defined when this method is called.
